children.text: There is visible evidence that the concrete has been installed with a time gap between supply, which has resulted in what appears to be cold joints in this area. These cold joints have not been designed or documented by the structural engineer, and may have implications on the structural integrity of the slab.
As a cold joint in a slab must be designed by the engineer, the builder should forward the engineering design and building surveyor’s inspection approval notice for this amendment to the slab.

In the absence of this documentation, the builder should demolish this section and reconstruct in accordance with the rectification design provided by the original design engineer. The owner should request a copy of the engineer’s rectification design and ensure that any work is carried out under the supervision and approval of the building surveyor.
